Texts.Eng: Deuterium is relatively common, but difficult to extract. It is also necessary for unstable particles which are *extremely* useful in the lab.
Enriched uranium finds itself a unique niche: armor piercing ability when applied to metallic rounds.
Relatively rare, but exceptionally useful, Thorium will provide a boost to your survival and ability to travel the stars.
Slightly more radioactive than uranium, and also a much more useful source of fuel, Neptunium will be your friend when you need it.
Tritium is produced by fission reaction, and is a viable means to obtain helium-3 as well, via extraction in a laboratory.
Who knows how this is even possible, but you have created a whole new type of radiation. Let us call it: Ultronium. Check out that fuel capability!
